decks.notes: The Boros Aggro deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with efficient creatures like Guide of Souls, Ragavan, and Amped Raptor, supported by burn spells like Lightning Bolt. The deck also includes cards like Static Prison and Galvanic Discharge to control the board and prevent the opponent from stabilizing. Aether Hub and Sacred Foundry provide mana fixing and ramp, while Arena of Glory boosts the team's power. The inclusion of Jegantha as a Companion adds an extra layer of synergy and versatility to the deck's game plan.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by disrupting the opponent's strategy through countering spells and removing key cards from their graveyard. The deck utilizes cards like Counterspell, Force of Negation, and Fatal Push to maintain control of the game. Additionally, the deck includes creatures like Murktide Regent and Harbinger of the Seas to apply pressure on the opponent while still maintaining a defensive stance. By controlling the board and disrupting the opponent's plans, this Dimir Control deck aims to outsmart and outlast its opponent in a battle of wits and strategy.

This Boros Aggro deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of efficient creatures and direct damage spells. By using cards like Amped Raptor and Guide of Souls to put pressure on the opponent, while using Lightning Bolt and Galvanic Discharge to clear the way for attacks, this deck seeks to end the game quickly. The inclusion of powerful cards like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Ajani, Nacatl Pariah adds a strong finisher to the deck, allowing for explosive turns that can seal the game in your favor.

This deck focuses on utilizing a combination of cards that allow for efficient and aggressive play without relying on lands. Through a mix of card draw, counterspells, and combo pieces such as Goblin Charbelcher and Lotus Bloom, the deck aims to quickly assemble the necessary components to win the game. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Hydroelectric Specimen provide additional support and utility to help control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy. Overall, the deck aims to win through a powerful combo while maintaining control of the game.

This Ruby Storm deck aims to quickly generate mana through spells like Desperate Ritual and Pyretic Ritual, allowing for explosive plays with cards like Wish and Past in Flames. The deck also includes card draw like Reckless Impulse and Glimpse the Impossible to find key combo pieces, while Ral, Monsoon Mage and Valakut Awakening provide additional utility and card advantage. By chaining together spells and utilizing mana generation efficiently, this deck can overwhelm opponents with a powerful storm of spells for a game-winning combo.

This deck focuses on generating mana quickly through ritual effects and Ruby Medallion to cast a string of red spells to overwhelm the opponent. Ral, Monsoon Mage and Reckless Impulse provide card advantage, while Wish allows for flexible tutoring. Glimpse the Impossible enables explosive turns by allowing the player to cast spells from the top of their library. Past in Flames can be used to recast spells from the graveyard to continue the combo. The deck aims to quickly assemble its combo pieces and burn the opponent out with a large Grapeshot finish.

The main focus of this Dimir Control deck is to disrupt and control the opponent's game plan through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and disruptive creatures. By using cards like Spell Snare, Fatal Push, Counterspell, and Thought Scour, the deck aims to keep the opponent's threats in check and prevent them from executing their strategy effectively. Additionally, the inclusion of cards like Murktide Regent and Overlord of the Balemurk provide powerful win conditions to close out the game once the opponent has been neutralized. Overall, the deck prioritizes disruption and control to secure victory.
